description.p: “My role as Gran Caster of the Silvermace Empire makes me one of the most influential men in our world. All my wishes are met, save for unlimited live subjects for my experiments. So, it was a great shock once I entered our soon to be new territory of Issadrem and found myself at the mercy of others. My prowess couldn’t be openly displayed for fear of being discovered in enemy territory, so I went from town to town looking for the kindness of strangers. I came to this land to see if their spiritual attunement would result in any difference presenting in their souls. In one of these villages I met Master Sur’Tzen, a galitarko that gave me a roof and a bowl fulll of food, along with invaluable wisdom. He told me that our soul, pure or evil, is like a cup of water. Emotions fill half the cup and logic fills the other half, but alone none quench our souls’ thirst. At that table my greatest setback was resolved. I had been looking for souls but never knew just how to locate them. I shall return to Evalnar at once.”
- Y. Mageshell, Manyhals of Death.

The galitarko are a people ruled by philosophy. They go through life resulute in their beliefs. Wether theirs is a philosophy of peace, evil or always choosing the lesser evil, a galitarko usually thinks twice when making a choice.
Galitarkos seem to be born with an assortment of abilities.
Ability Score Increase. Your Strength score increases by 2.
Age. Galitarkos reach adulthood at around 9 years old and live about 50 years.
Size. Galitarkos stand between 6 and 8 feet tall and average about 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Claws. Your claws are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Mauling Strike. Immediately after you move at least 20 feet, you can make one melee attack with your claws as a bonus action.
Bearable. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Mortal subtype. Three main subtypes of galitarko populate Faleria: Grizzly, Panda and Polar Galitarko. Choose one of these subtypes.

The grizzly galitarko wear a resemblance to either black, brown or grey bears. Natural of Manyhal and western Zeiloryn, these huge mortals can produce a fierce roar, unlike any other. Though they might seem brutish, many carry the philosophy of Lendo, that teaches you to always try to work for the greater good. In the case of the galitarko on the western side of Zeiloryn, that meant joining the empire and it’s conquest.
Grizzly galitarko often have only one name derived from an adjective given while they were young, such as Fasten, Hungrial, Madden and Swiffy.

The panda galitarko wear a resemblance to either giant, qinling or red pandas. Natural of Issadrem, these spot furred mortals are known for their selflessness. Followers of the Iendu philosophy, that teaches you to follow the path to self improvement and communal harmony. They protect their lands and those of others even if that means taking up arms.

Panda galitarko follow the naming convention that’s prevalent in Issadrem, with two different parts separated by an apostrophe. The first part functions as a one syllable family name and the second as a name for each person. Examples of this naming convention are ones such as Sur’Tzen, Gar’Meren, Pol’Jalgoren and Gra’Cious.

As a drow, you are infused with the magic of the Underdark, an underground realm of wonders and horrors rarely seen on the surface above. You are at home in shadows and, thanks to your innate magic, learn to conjure forth both light and darkness. Your kin tend to have stark white hair and grayish skin of many hues.

The cult of the god Lolth, Queen of Spiders, has corrupted some of the oldest drow cities, especially in the worlds of Oerth and Toril. Eberron, Krynn, and other realms have escaped the cult’s influence—for now. Wherever the cult lurks, drow heroes stand on the front lines in the war against it, seeking to sunder Lolth’s web.
Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma score increases by 1.
Superior Darkvision. Your darkvision has a radius of 120 feet.

Sunlight Sensitivity. You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

Drow Magic. You know the dancing lights cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the faerie fire spell, you must finish a long rest to cast the spell again with the trait. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the darkness spell, you must finish a long rest to cast the spell again with the trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
Drow Weapon Training. You have proficiency with rapiers, shortswords, and hand crossbows.
